meanings.definition: The amount by which something, especially a sum of money, is too small.
meanings.sent1: The deficit in his savings made it hard to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: The government is trying to reduce the deficit in its budget.
meanings.sent3: His deficit of coins in the piggy bank left him feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The deficit in her lunchbox was like a black hole swallowing all the snacks.
meanings.sent5: The deficit in her allowance was as noticeable as a missing puzzle piece.

meanings.sent1: The deficit of food in the pantry meant they had to order takeout.
meanings.sent2: The deficit of volunteers made it challenging to organize the event.
meanings.sent3: His deficit of jokes at the party made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent4: The deficit of stars in the sky that night made it seem darker than usual.
meanings.sent5: The deficit of colors in the painting gave it a minimalist feel.
